projects.title: Belgrade Model European Union
projects.description:
Belgrade Model European Union (BEUM) is all about gathering more than 300 future young leaders of the Old Continent together with one main goal – to simulate the decision making procedures within the European Union. It also serves as a platform to present the opinions of the youth on the current crisis in Europe.
It is about strengthening connections between young professionals, exchanging different ideas, meeting different cultures and languages, practising personal skills, learning about how the European Union really functions and how can the young people make their voice heard in those processes.

contributors.headline: Master Student Applied Physics | Master thesis project at Physics of Interfaces and Nanomaterials (PIN)

projects.title: Energy Innovation Talks
projects.description: During the Energy Innovation Talks the 'Topsector Energie' challenged studentes and young professionals to find creative and innovative ideas, that wil make a energy transition possible. After a masterclass with focus on 5 topics, participants were selected to be part of the 'werkconferentie topsector energie Nederland' where the ideas were presented. As a participant I focused on district heating/heat networks.

contributors.headline: Master Student Applied Physics | Master thesis project at Physics of Interfaces and Nanomaterials (PIN)

projects.title: Model European Union Stasbourg
projects.description:
Model European Union Strasbourg (MEUS) is a unique simulation of EU decision-making and politics that takes place annually in Strasbourg.
The conference brings together 200 highly motivated students and young professional, giving them the exclusive opportunity to have first-hand experience of the functioning of European institutions right on the premises of the European Parliament. The project is thus completely original in the world of simulations and is already extremely popular among young Europeans from diverse backgrounds, from Law, International Relations, Political Science and European Affairs to History, Media Studies, and Interpreting.
During this conference two topics were discussed: the refugee crisis and biofuels.  
My role was Member of Parlement representing France in the Greens.  During the program I was elected by my peers as faction leader. Not only was the goal to gain support of the other MEP's during the debates but also to convince the council, the journalists ,and the lobbyists.

projects.title: Speaker at Offshore Energy Exhibition and Conference 2021
projects.description:
I was part of a panel that discussed with OEEC host Eva Brouwer: the role of the younger generation in the energy transition, how the issue of sustainability is being tackled, and Greta Thunberg.

The panel consisted of Dione Zijp, secretary of Youth For Climate, Tessa Dool, board member at Youth Climate Vision at the Jonge Klimaatbeweging, and Elise de Groote, a student of Applied Physics at University Twente and part of Energietalenten.

profile_positions.description: As a Teaching Assistant(TA) I help during module 7 of Advanced Technology and module 4 of Electrical Engineering with the tutorials, lectures, and the antenna project. The "Fields&Waves" module covers electrostatics, magnetostatics, and electrodynamics.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Chair of the OLC of the bachelor Advanced Technology. 
The OLC is an advisory council that provides advice and gives consent to major changes in the study, to the director of Advanced Technology. The OLC consists of 4 student members and 4 staff members both of Advanced Technology. I lead and participate in every meeting (once every two months) and try to improve the quality of the education of Advanced Technology.
profile_positions.title: Chair of the program committee  of the bachelor Advanced Technology.

profile_positions.description: Teaching Assistant of module 1 Mechanics tutorials, modeling project, and trainer for academic presenting.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: As a member of the Faculty Council Science & Technology, I represented the Advanced Technology students, discussed the educational issues within the faculty, and protected the rights of the students. The Faculty Council is a co-decision body of the management team of the faculty. The faculty council consists of seven student members and seven staff members.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Faculty Council Science & Technology

profile_positions.description: As a student for a day mentor, I informed prospective Advanced Technology students about the study, took them along my lectures for a day and showed them around the University & campus.
profile_positions.title: Student for a day guide

profile_positions.description: During this research internship, I acquired skills (chemical synthesis, characterization (XRD, SEM, EDX, Raman), participated in synchrotron experiments (RIXS, XAS, STXM) and gained relevant work experience. I conducted a research project focused on 2-dimensional materials for pseudocapacitive devices at the Young Investigator Group Nanoscale Solid-Liquid Interfaces which is part of Helmholtz-Zentrum Berlin (HZB).
profile_positions.title: Internship Helmholtz-Zentrum Berlin
Scholarship Energy Talent (ET) | Comunnity Energy Top Talent (CETT)

profile_positions.description: I developed a 5-day virtual program for international youth called Climate Change & Sustainable Solutions. The course was offered to young adults ages 16-18 looking to dive deep into a topic of interest with their peers from around the world. It is offered as a part of the CRS leadership program.
profile_positions.title: Program Developer

profile_positions.description: As Commissioner of Eternal Relations I am part of the 13th board of the Study Association Astatine. Astatine represents both the study Advanced Technology and the Master Nano Technology. My main responsibilities as a board member is to show the members their career opportunities, connecting them with possible employers, and acquire the financial support needed to run the association.
profile_positions.title: Board member & Commissioner of External Relations

profile_positions.description: As coordinating researcher, I coordinate a research that is focused on the political obstacles and possibilities in regards to the energy transition within regions of Europe. The findings of the research will be presented at the conference of the European Free Alliance & Fryske Nasjonale Party in Leeuwarden. The goal of this research is to give insights to the regions and help them making more informed decisions (learn from the best practices and mistakes of other regions ) when making their energy policy.
profile_positions.title: coordinating researcher CMC project

profile_positions.description:
University of Twente Model United Nations (UT MUN) is focused on creating a unique event for the students of the University of Twente. Model United Nations is a world wide known concept that teaches the leaders of tomorrow about diplomacy, international relations, politics, public speaking and the work of the United Nations. Its main goal is to involve (technical) students with current world problems in a unique way. 
As director general and chair I am part of the executive board and therefore, responsible for the overall organization of 40 students and its subcommittees.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder and Chair of UT MUN

profile_positions.description:
YouthCORE is a environmental conference that creates a start and impulse for the ENCORE. 
During the YouthCORE it is expected of the ambassadors to discuss problems and possible solutions for current environmental issues. At the start of the ENCORE opening a 30 minute presentation has taken place on the 15th of May at the BMW Welt to give suggestions and demands of the younger generation to the ministers of 17 European regions. 

I have worked on the topic awareness among citizens and presented this at the start of the ENCORE event. 

*http://www.provincie.drenthe.nl/onderwerpen/natuur-milieu/klimaat-energie/nieuwsberichten/@111820/drentse-deelnemers/
profile_positions.title: Ambassador of the region Drenthe in the Youth environmental Conference of the Regions of Europe

volunteer_experiences.description:
I help to select campers for the international leadership program called Camp Rising Sun. The at-large selection committee is an international committee that selects campers from places around the world that do not have a current selection committee. 
Part of this work is reading and reviewing written applications (round 1) as well as conducting interviews (round 2).

The Educational committee (Educo) is a committee within Astatine. The goal of the Educo is to contribute to the educational system. This is done both by addressing problems, advising on future changes in the system and offering help with the study. 
The current topics I am working on is focused on informing students about extra curricular activities, organising the teacher debate and informing students about the regulations.

volunteer_experiences.role: Second years mentor at Camp Rising Sun 2013
volunteer_experiences.description:
The mission of LAJF is to 'develop in promising young people from diverse backgrounds a lifelong commitment to sensitive and responsible leadership for the betterment of their communities and world'.
This mission is carried out by Camp Rising Sun's international, full-scholarship, leadership summer program for young students of 14-16 years. 
The Second years at Camp Rising Sun carry the responsibility to pass along traditions and being a mentor to the first years, as well as, a fellow camper and friend.

Within this committee I organised together with my fellow students a symposium focused on Autonomous Systems. As External Relations I was responsible for finding inspiring speakers and financial partners.

volunteer_experiences.role: Chair and founder of the ComCon
volunteer_experiences.description:
The ComCon is a committee focused on looking for excursions, lunchlectures, workshops and all other ways to connect students with their future employees. 
During this year we organised excursions/lunchlecture with high tech companies, financial companies as well as many industrial and consultancy companies. This broad range of industries gave the students of Advanced Technology the opportunity to give more insight for their future career.
